body: It works with Thermal Comfort Indices component too: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/JomcnL50vYCoykOKOPWNhxIJYUfJMcTHVPJ8FFTGysOcdAO93uKrryUonbd66tpjPJlTYndDJB3-MErSun41E*bEDUAeRrbT/ENVImet_Canopy.jpg)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/JomcnL50vYChF9INak4JJTgzHqXZmiXkjP7eMeCLwutEzcR2kSyY7oMGCl*m-AGg-VZPQ36xoC8AVjmr3*8aUSgU97XCeRyy/ENVImet_Canopy2.jpg) Thank you Antonello for providing the example file, simulation files and guidance!! [ENVI-met simulation files](https://www.dropbox.com/s/1audy88vrm4zj48/ENVImet_Canopy.zip?dl=0) need to be extracted to "c:" partition in order for the .gh file to work.
